ts.support

Class TSDeclarativeEnvironmentRecord

  • java.lang.Object
    • ts.support.TSEnvironmentRecord
      • ts.support.TSDeclarativeEnvironmentRecord

  • final class TSDeclarativeEnvironmentRecord
extends TSEnvironmentRecord
    The class for Tscript declarative environment record (ELS 10.2.1.1).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TSDeclarativeEnvironmentRecord()
      Create a declarative environment record by creating a HashMap to connect names to their bindings (value and attributes).

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      (package private) void createImmutableBinding(TSString name)
      Create an immutable binding for a name.
      (package private) void createMutableBinding(TSString name, boolean isDeletable)
      Create a mutable binding for a name.
      (package private) TSNumber deleteBinding(TSString name)
      Try to delete a binding for a name.
      (package private) TSValue getBindingValue(TSString name)
      Get the value from a binding for a name.
      (package private) boolean hasBinding(TSString name)
      Does the environment have a binding for the given name?
      (package private) TSValue implicitThisValue()
      Always returns "undefined" because there is never a "this" value for an environment.
      (package private) void initializeImmutableBinding(TSString name, TSValue value)
      Put the initial (and final) value into a immutable binding for a name.
      (package private) void setMutableBinding(TSString name, TSValue value)
      Connect a value to a mutable binding for a name.

    • Method Detail

      • hasBinding

        boolean hasBinding(TSString name)
        Does the environment have a binding for the given name?
        Specified by:
        hasBinding in class TSEnvironmentRecord
        Parameters:
        name - name to be searched for
        Returns:
        true or false, does the name have a binding in this environment?

      • createMutableBinding

        void createMutableBinding(TSString name,
                        boolean isDeletable)
        Create a mutable binding for a name. Note that there is no value in the binding at this point.
        Specified by:
        createMutableBinding in class TSEnvironmentRecord
        Parameters:
        name - name to create the binding for
        isDeletable - indicates whether the new binding can be deleted

      • setMutableBinding

        void setMutableBinding(TSString name,
                     TSValue value)
        Connect a value to a mutable binding for a name. Note that the binding must already exist.
        Specified by:
        setMutableBinding in class TSEnvironmentRecord
        Parameters:
        name - name whose value should be updated
        value - value to be assigned to the name

      • getBindingValue

        TSValue getBindingValue(TSString name)
        Get the value from a binding for a name.
        Specified by:
        getBindingValue in class TSEnvironmentRecord
        Parameters:
        name - name to get the binding value for
        Returns:
        the binding value found for the name

      • deleteBinding

        TSNumber deleteBinding(TSString name)
        Try to delete a binding for a name.
        Specified by:
        deleteBinding in class TSEnvironmentRecord
        Parameters:
        name - name to be deleted
        Returns:
        success (1) or failure (0). TODO: the return type should be TSBoolean.

      • implicitThisValue

        TSValue implicitThisValue()
        Always returns "undefined" because there is never a "this" value for an environment.
        Specified by:
        implicitThisValue in class TSEnvironmentRecord
        Returns:
        the implicit "this" value for this environment

      • createImmutableBinding

        void createImmutableBinding(TSString name)
        Create an immutable binding for a name. Note there is no value at this point. Assumes an immutable binding is not deletable.
        Parameters:
        name - name to create a binding for

      • initializeImmutableBinding

        void initializeImmutableBinding(TSString name,
                              TSValue value)
        Put the initial (and final) value into a immutable binding for a name.
        Parameters:
        name - name to be initialized
        value - value to assign to the name
